    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770205413</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Percussion: San Francisco Taiko Dojo</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Perkussion: San Francisco Taiko Dojo</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Percussion : Dojo de San Francisco Taiko</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Percussão: Dojo Do San Francisco Taiko</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Percussione: Dojo De San Francisco Taiko</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Κρούση: Σαν Φρανσίσκο Taiko Dojo</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Percusión: Dojo De San Francisco Taiko</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">SPARK follows Sensei Seiichi Tanaka and Taiko Dojo as they prepare for the 36th annual International Taiko Festival at Berkeley's Zellerbach Hall. This Educator Guide is about the history and traditions of the ancient art of Taiko drumming in Japan and the contemporary innovations of a global music culture.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Humanities</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Social Sciences</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Arts</string>
          </keyword>
          <coverage>
            <string language="en">North America</string>
          </coverage>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">FUNKEN folgt Sensei Seiichi Tanaka und Taiko Dojo,
während sie für das 36th jährliche internationale Taiko Festival 
bei Zellerbach Hall Berkeley sich vorbereiten. Diese 
Erzieher-Anleitung ist über die Geschichte und die Traditionen der 
alten kunst von Taiko trommelnd in Japan und in den zeitgenössischen 
Innovationen einer globalen Musikkultur.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">L'ÉTINCELLE suit Sensei Seiichi Tanaka et dojo de
Taiko pendant qu'ils se préparent au trente-sixième festival 
international annuel de Taiko chez Zellerbach Hall de Berkeley. 
Ce guide d'éducateur est au sujet de l'histoire et des 
traditions de l'art antique de Taiko battant du tambour au Japon et 
aux innovations contemporaines d'une culture globale de musique.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">A FAÍSCA segue Sensei Seiichi Tanaka e dojo de 
Taiko enquanto se preparam para o 36th festival internacional anual de
Taiko em Zellerbach Salão de Berkeley. Esta guia do educador é
sobre o history e as tradições da arte antiga de Taiko que rufa em 
Japão e nas inovações contemporary de uma cultura global da 
música.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">La SCINTILLA segue Sensei Seiichi Tanaka ed il 
dojo di Taiko mentre si preparano per il trentaseesimo Festival 
internazionale annuale di Taiko a Zellerbach Corridoio del Berkeley. 
Questa guida dell'educatore è circa la storia e le tradizioni 
dell'arte antica di Taiko che tamburella nel Giappone e le innovazioni
contemporanee di una coltura globale di musica.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Ο ΣΠΙΝΘΗΡΑΣ ακολουθεί Sensei Seiichi Tanaka και 
Taiko Dojo όπως προετοιμάζονται για το 36$ο ετήσιο διεθνές 
φεστιβάλ Taiko στην αίθουσα Zellerbach του Μπέρκλεϋ. 
Αυτός ο οδηγός εκπαιδευτικών είναι για την ιστορία και τις 
παραδόσεις αρχαίας τέχνης Taiko παίζοντας τύμπανο στην 
Ιαπωνία και σύγχρονων καινοτομιών ενός σφαιρικού πολιτισμού 
μουσικής.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">La CHISPA sigue Sensei Seiichi Tanaka y el dojo de
Taiko mientras que se preparan para el 36.o festival internacional 
anual de Taiko en Zellerbach Pasillo de Berkeley. Esta guía del
educador está sobre la historia y las tradiciones del arte antiguo de
Taiko que teclea en Japón y las innovaciones contemporáneas de una 
cultura global de la música.</string>
          </description>
